definition: drunken gluttony (idiom); eating and drinking to excess

sentences.english: Hungry rats that binge on sugar provoke a surge of dopamine in their brains.
sentences.chinese: 狂饮糖的饥饿大鼠在它们的脑中激起了多巴胺巨浪。

sentences.english: They went to a beerhouse and beered up.
sentences.chinese: 他们到一家啤酒店狂饮啤酒。

sentences.english: It is a hallmark in Chinese festival celebration to get boozed up.
sentences.chinese: 过节狂饮是中国传统的风俗之一。

sentences.english: Many alcoholics go on drinking sprees that continue for days at a time.
sentences.chinese: 许多酒鬼一次要狂饮好几天。

sentences.english: He ordered a cheese sandwich, a three bottle of beer and beered up.
sentences.chinese: 他要了一份乳酪三明治和三瓶啤酒狂饮起来。

sentences.english: She is mainlining wine this week.
They liquored up at the feast.
This is also the time when you are most likely to guzzle down more coffee and eat a high-sugar treat.
sentences.chinese: 这也是你会狂饮咖啡，暴食高糖份大餐的时刻。

sentences.english: They went out boozing late last night.
sentences.chinese: 他们昨晚出去狂饮至深夜。

sentences.english: He never used to drink during the week but when saturday night arrived he drank until he was quite maudlin.
sentences.chinese: 他平日不喝酒，但在周六晚上常会狂饮直至有些伤感。

definition: to have a few drinks/to drink to one's heart's content
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
the contents of the cup/(fig.) liquor/wine
to get thoroughly drunk (idiom)/to get plastered
lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk
alcohol drunk to drown one's sorrows
